And I will [xref]a[/xref]pour out on the house of David and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem the [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]Spirit of grace and of supplications; and they will [note]2[/note]look upon Me, whom [note]3[/note]they have [note]4[/note][xref]c[/xref]pierced; and they will wail over Him with wailing as for an [note]5[/note]only [xref]d[/xref]son and cry bitterly over Him with bitter crying as for a [note]5[/note]firstborn son.
verse.note: In Acts 2 God poured out His Spirit upon all flesh, and three thousand were saved ([link]Acts 2:17[/link], [link]41[/link]). But when God pours out the Spirit of grace upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, many thousands of Israel, even the entire race of Israel alive at that time, will be saved ([link]Rom. 11:26-27[/link]). The Spirit of grace here is in contrast to the Spirit of power in [link]Acts 1:8[/link] and [link]2:1-4[/link]. The Spirit of power is to strengthen us, but the Spirit of grace is to bring us into the enjoyment of the Triune God. In Acts 2, at the beginning of the age of grace, the church age, the Spirit was mainly the Spirit of power, but in this verse, at the end, the consummation, of the age of grace, the Spirit will be mainly the Spirit of grace for the enjoyment of the Triune God. The Jews on the day of Pentecost were stubborn and hard; hence, the Spirit of power was poured out to inspire them to repent. But the half of the inhabitants of Jerusalem that survive the attack of Antichrist and his armies ([link]14:2[/link]) will have lost their taste for everything other than God and will have already repented. Therefore, the Spirit of grace will be poured out upon them so that they can receive the Triune God as their enjoyment.

At the end of the war of Armageddon, Christ will come to earth, and the remnant of Israel will look on Him whom they have pierced ([link]John 19:34[/link], [link]37[/link]; [link]Rev. 1:7[/link]), will repent and wail, and will believe in Christ and receive Him. In this way all Israel will be saved ([link]Rom. 11:26-27[/link]). This will be the household salvation rendered to Israel by God.
Although it was their forefathers who pierced the Lord Jesus, God counts that as something done by these repentant ones.
The piercing of Christ is the foundation of redemption ([link]John 19:34[/link]). Apart from Christ's being pierced, there is no base for our redemption.

Repentant Israel will wail over Christ as the only Son of God ([link]John 1:18[/link]; [link]3:16[/link]) and will cry bitterly over Him as the firstborn Son of God ([link]Rom. 8:29[/link]; [link]Heb. 1:6a[/link]). Christ's being the only begotten Son is for us to be redeemed and to receive eternal life ([link]John 3:14-16[/link]). Christ's becoming the firstborn Son through His death and resurrection ([link]Rom. 1:3-4[/link]) is for us to become sons of God as heirs to inherit all the riches of what God is, that is, to receive, participate in, and enjoy all the riches of the Triune God ([link]Rom. 8:14-17[/link]; [link]Gal. 3:26[/link], [link]29[/link]). In their repentance Israel will realize that as the only begotten Son Christ has redeemed them and has brought them eternal life and that as the firstborn Son He has made them heirs to inherit the riches of the Triune God as their enjoyment.

verse.text: In that day there will be great [xref]a[/xref]wailing in Jerusalem, like the wailing of Hadad-rimmon in the valley of [xref]b[/xref]Megiddon.

And the land will [xref]a[/xref]wail, every family by itself: the [note]1[/note]family of the house of David by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of the house of [xref]b[/xref]Nathan by itself, and their wives by themselves;
verse.note: Zechariah uses three kinds of families — the royal family of David (David and Nathan), the family of the priesthood (Levi), and the family of an evil man (Shimei, who cursed David — [link]2 Sam. 16:5-8[/link]) — as illustrations. All those who look upon Christ, the pierced One, with a repentant spirit, will wail over Him.

verse.text: The family of the house of Levi by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of the Shimeites by itself, and their wives by themselves;
All the families that remain, every family by itself, and their wives by themselves.
In that day there will be an [note]1[/note]opened [xref]a[/xref]fountain for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem, [xref]b[/xref]for sin and for impurity.
verse.note: This opened fountain is Christ's pierced side ([link]John 19:34[/link], [link]37[/link]), which was opened for the accomplishing of redemption.

verse.text: And in that day, declares Jehovah of hosts, I will cut off the names of the idols from the land, and they will no longer be remembered; and I will also cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to pass from the land.

And if anyone still prophesies, his father and mother, who begot him, will say to him, You shall not live, for you have spoken falsely in the name of Jehovah; and his father and mother, who begot him, will pierce him through when he prophesies.
And in that day the prophets will each be ashamed of his vision when he prophesies; and they will not wear a [xref]a[/xref]hairy garment in order to deceive.
But He will say, I am [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]no prophet; I am a tiller of the ground; for a man sold Me in My youth.
verse.note: [link]Verses 2-4[/link] speak of God's causing the false prophets to pass from the land. This cleared the way for Christ to come in as the real Prophet. However, Christ said that He was not a prophet but a tiller of the ground. This means that He was not the kind of prophet, a false prophet, mentioned in the preceding verses. Christ came to be the real Prophet ([link]Matt. 13:57[/link]; [link]Deut. 18:15-19[/link], cf. [link]Acts 3:22[/link]) but was rejected and wounded in His side in the house of Israel, His relatives in the flesh ([link]vv. 5-6[/link]; [link]12:10[/link]). That wound became the base of their redemption, which Christ accomplished for them in His death.

verse.text: And [i]someone[/i] will say to Him, What are these [xref]a[/xref]wounds between Your arms? And He will say, Those with which I was wounded in the house of those who [note]1[/note]love Me.
verse.note: The children of Israel killed Christ, but in this sweet word Christ counts their action as wounds from those who love Him.

verse.text: Awake, O sword, against My Shepherd, / And against the man [i]who is[/i] My [note]1[/note]Fellow, / Declares Jehovah of hosts.[separator][xref]a[/xref]Strike the Shepherd, / That the sheep may be [xref]b[/xref]scattered; / And I will turn My hand upon the [note]2[/note]little ones.
verse.note: Christ, the Fellow of Jehovah, came as the God-sent Shepherd to the children of Israel ([link]11:7[/link]; [link]Matt. 9:36[/link]; [link]John 10:11[/link]) but was attacked unto death by them ([link]v. 7a[/link]; [link]Matt. 26:31[/link]; [link]Acts 2:23[/link]). As a man Christ was both a relative of the children of Israel and a Fellow of Jehovah. As He was hanging on the cross, His relatives wounded Him ([link]v. 6[/link]), and God called in the sword to strike Him.

[i]Little ones[/i] here refers to the people of Israel. This indicates that God reacted to the rejection of Christ by the children of Israel and turned His hand upon them as the little ones by punishing them through Titus the Roman prince and his army in A.D. 70 and scattering them into the nations to be despised, humiliated, persecuted, and destroyed throughout the age of grace until today ([link]Matt. 21:41a[/link]; [link]23:38[/link]; [link]24:2[/link]). This is God's sovereign preparation of a people to receive the Redeemer with His redemption and His salvation. See notes [link chapter="12"]10[sup]1[/sup][/link] and [link]10[sup]2[/sup] in ch. 12[/link].

verse.text: And in all the land, declares Jehovah, / [note]1[/note]Two parts in it will be cut off [i]and[/i] will die, / But the third part will be left in it.
verse.note: In the great tribulation at the consummation of the present age, in all the land of Israel two-thirds of the people will be cut off, slaughtered, by Antichrist in his persecution of the Jews ([link]Rev. 11:2[/link]; [link]13:7[/link]). One-third of the remnant will be left in the land and will be brought through fire and refined like silver and tried like gold by the persecution of Antichrist ([link]vv. 8b-9a[/link]). These will be those who are written in the book as the secret record ([link]Dan. 12:1b[/link]). They will call on the Lord's name, and the Lord will answer them. The Lord will say that they are His people, and they will say that the Lord is their God ([link]v. 9b[/link]). They will be saved into the enjoyment of the riches of the Triune God, first in the millennium to be the priests to teach the nations ([link]8:20-23[/link]; [link]Isa. 2:3[/link]) and then in the New Jerusalem to participate in all the blessings God has ordained in eternity and for eternity (see [link]Rev. 21:12b[/link] and note 4, par. 2). This is the household salvation to Israel ([link]Rom. 11:26-27[/link]). See note [link]1[sup]3[/sup] in Dan. 12[/link].

verse.text: And I will bring the third part through [xref]a[/xref]fire / And [xref]b[/xref]refine them as silver is refined / And try them as gold is tried. / They will call on My name, / And I will answer them; / I will say, They are My [xref]c[/xref]people, / And they will say, Jehovah is my God.
Indeed a day is coming for Jehovah when the spoil [i]taken[/i] from you will be divided among you.

For I will [xref]a[/xref]gather all the nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city will be captured, and the houses plundered, and the women ravished; and [note]1[/note]half of the city will go forth into captivity, but the rest of the people will not be cut off from the city.
verse.note: In the great tribulation Antichrist and his armies will slaughter two-thirds of the Jews ([link]13:8[/link] and note). Of the one-third remaining in the land, most will probably be in the area of Jerusalem. Out of this one-third, half the city will be captured by Antichrist. In His mercy God will preserve the remaining half. Antichrist will attempt to destroy them also; however, as revealed in [link]vv. 3-7[/link], Jehovah as Christ will come with His saints ([link]vv. 3[/link], [link]5[/link]) and go forth to fight against and defeat Antichrist and his followers, the nations ([link]Joel 3:11[/link]; [link]Rev. 17:14[/link]; [link]19:11-21[/link]). This will result in Israel's household salvation ([link]Rom. 11:26-27[/link]). See [link]12:8-10[/link] and notes.

verse.text: Then Jehovah will go forth and [xref]a[/xref]fight against those nations, as when He fights in a day of battle.

And His [note]1[/note]feet will stand in that day on the [xref]a[/xref]Mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east; and the Mount of Olives will be split at its middle toward the east and toward the west into a very great valley, so that half of the mountain will remove to the north and half of it to the south.
verse.note: In fulfillment of [link]Acts 1:11[/link] the feet of Jehovah as Christ will stand in that day on the Mount of Olives.

verse.text: And you will flee into the valley of My mountains, for the valley of the mountains will reach unto Azel; yes, you will flee, just as you fled before the [xref]a[/xref]earthquake in the days of Uzziah the king of Judah. And Jehovah my God will [xref]b[/xref]come, [i]and[/i] all the saints with [note]1[/note]Him.
verse.note: Some MSS read, You.

verse.text: And in that day there will be [xref]a[/xref]no light; [note]1[/note]the shining ones will withdraw.
verse.note: The shining ones here are the sun, the moon, and the stars. The things that take place in [link]vv. 6-7[/link] indicate that God will change a number of things in the universe in order to judge the evil human beings and to save His elect.

verse.text: For it will be a [i]kind of[/i] day [xref]a[/xref]known only to Jehovah, neither day nor night; but at evening time there will be light.

And in that day [note]1[/note]living [xref]a[/xref]waters will go forth from Jerusalem; half of them toward the [note]2[/note]eastern sea and half of them toward the [note]3[/note]western sea; it will be there in summer and in winter.
verse.note: In the millennium there will be no thirst, for living waters will go forth from Jerusalem. This is similar to the record in [link]Ezek. 47:1-2[/link].
I.e., the Dead Sea.
I.e., the Mediterranean Sea.

verse.text: And Jehovah will be [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]King over all the earth; and in that day Jehovah will be the one [i]God[/i] and His name the one [i]name.[/i]
verse.note: In the millennium Jehovah as Christ will be King over all the earth ([link]9:10b[/link]; [link]Psa. 72:8[/link]), and He will be the one God and His name the one name.

verse.text: All the land will be changed into a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem; and [i]Jerusalem[/i] will be raised and will dwell in her place, from Benjamin's Gate to the place of the First Gate to the Corner Gate, and [i]from[/i] the Tower of [xref]a[/xref]Hananel to the king's winepresses.
And [i]people[/i] will dwell in her, and there will be [xref]a[/xref]no more curse, for Jerusalem will [xref]b[/xref]dwell securely.

And this will be the plague with which Jehovah will strike all the peoples who have fought against Jerusalem: Their flesh will rot while they are standing on their feet, and their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongue will rot in their mouth.
And in that day a great panic from Jehovah will be among them; and each will seize his neighbor's hand, and his hand will rise up against his neighbor's hand.
And Judah will also fight at Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the surrounding nations will be gathered together, gold and silver and garments, in great abundance.
And as this plague is, so will the plague be on the horse, the mule, the camel, the donkey, and all the cattle that are in those camps.

And everyone left from all the nations that went forth against Jerusalem will go up from year to year to [xref]a[/xref]worship the King, Jehovah of hosts, and to keep the [xref]b[/xref]Feast of Tabernacles.
And whichever of the families of the earth does [xref]a[/xref]not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, Jehovah of hosts, upon them there will be [note]1[/note]no rain.
verse.note: Because the present age is the age of grace, God sends rain on the just and the unjust alike ([link]Matt. 5:45[/link]). However, the coming age will be the age of righteousness. Those who do not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King and to keep the Feast of Tabernacles will not receive rain.

verse.text: And if the family of Egypt does not go up and enter, there will be no [i]rain[/i] upon them; there will be the plague with which Jehovah strikes the nations that do not go up to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
This will be the sin of Egypt and the sin of all the nations that do not go up to keep the Feast of Tabernacles.
In that day on the horses' bells will be, [xref]a[/xref]Holiness to Jehovah; and the [note]1[/note]pots in the house of Jehovah will be like the basins before the altar.
verse.note: Pots are small, whereas the basins are large; but in the millennium the pots in the house of God will be as large as the basins before the altar.

verse.text: Indeed every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holiness to Jehovah of hosts; and all those who sacrifice will come and take of them and boil in them; and there will never again be a [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Canaanite in the house of Jehovah of hosts in that day.
verse.note: Or, merchant.
